rules: Rule1: Provided that the researcher used a laptop device, then the researcher attended a workshop event.
Rule2: Whenever the researcher networked with an industry expert happens, the researcher winning the best paper award follows.

Rule3: Under the condition that the researcher gave a keynote talk, then if it is not the case that (if the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks, then the researcher has the skill of AI programming), the researcher attended a workshop event.
Rule4: If the researcher chaired the ML track session, then either the researcher networked with an industry expert or the researcher gave a keynote talk.
Rule5: Either the researcher chaired the ML track session or the researcher demoed a prototype.
Rule6: Provided that the researcher demoed a prototype, then either the researcher networked with an industry expert or the researcher gave a keynote talk.

Rule7: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks, then the researcher has the skill of AI programming), then the researcher used a laptop device.
Rule8: If the tech conference was not funded, then the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks.
Rule9: Provided that the tech conference was not funded, then it is not the case that the researcher has the skill of AI programming.
facts: Fact1: The researcher did not attend a workshop event.
Fact2: It is not the case that the researcher won the best paper award.
